      • getSlope

        Returns:

      • drawStraightLine

        public void drawStraightLine(java.awt.Graphics g,
                             int centerX,
                             int centerY)
        This method will use the given Graphics awt to draw a straight line between the two coordinate pairs defined. To use, call it in the overridden paintComponent method in your JPanel object of choice. Pass in the center coordinates of your JPanel to treat the center vertex as the origin vertex, and offset each coordinate accordingly. This method can altered for use in any coordinate-based drawing program.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics awt object being used
        centerX - the center x-coordinate of the JPanel
        centerY - the center y-coordinate of the JPanel

      • computeDistance

        public static double computeDistance(Vertex vertex1,
                                     Vertex vertex2)
        This method will use the distance formula to calculate the straight-path distance between two vertices.
        Parameters:
        vertex1 - the first vertex
        vertex2 - the second vertex
        Returns:
        the straight-path distance from the vertex1 to vertex2

      • computeSlope

        private static double computeSlope(Vertex vertex1,
                                   Vertex vertex2)
        This method computes the slope of the line using the two coordinate pairs that belong to the object. Slope equation: m = (y2-y1)/(x2-x1)
        Parameters:
        vertex1 - the first vertex
        vertex2 - the second vertex
        Returns:
        the slope of the line between vertex1 and vertex2

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString method for StraightLine. Displays the calculated length and slope of the line.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string containing the instance variable's current values
